instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID_LEFT: What is SMC_LID_LEFT? SMC_LID_LEFT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the left LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed â€“ if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_LEFT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> kernel panic sleep wake issue
threads.message:
system crashing, was able to boot into safe mode and turn off sleep setting, MacBook is on and working but not sellable in this condition, wondering if there is a fix for this, it is a very common issue , 
panic(cpu 6 caller 0xffffff7fa8b33f00): "virtual bool IOAccelDisplayMachine::<SIGNAL>DISPLAY_MODE_DID_CHANGE</SIGNAL>(<SIGNAL>UINT32_T</SIGNAL>): AMDRadeonAccelerator driver returns false" @IOAccelDisplayMachine.cpp:345

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> kernel panic sleep wake issue
threads.message:
Seems to be GPU related issue.
Did you try to reinstall the macOS?
You can also try DFU restore.

Just in case, check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT</SIGNAL>/RIGHT and <SIGNAL>IPD_LID_OPEN</SIGNAL> signals, when close/open the lid.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> kernel panic sleep wake issue
threads.message: just got home from work, laptop is still on, but in safe mode, sleep settings have been changed, so i restarted, unit is still crashing, if i hold shift key it will boot normal, prob still gpu issue,  but figured i would add new info that it only loads in safe mode,  not sure if that points to a different issue

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> kernel panic sleep wake issue
threads.message:
In safe mode GPU driver is not loaded.
That explains why stays on...
